description: Clear the screen by shooting and splitting bouncing bubbles into smaller pieces.
rationale: This game targets players who enjoy timing-based arcade shooters. It offers a clear progression system and physics-based challenges that are ideal for training AI agents in spatial reasoning and projectile timing.
details: The player controls a character at the bottom of a rectangular 2D arena. Large bubbles bounce around the screen following basic gravity and wall collision physics. The player can move left or right and fire a vertical wire-shot upwards. When the wire hits a bubble, the bubble splits into two smaller bubbles that pop in opposite directions. The smallest bubbles disappear when hit. The game ends if a bubble touches the player or if the time limit expires. Each level introduces different bubble sizes and platform layouts.

game_rules.bubble_physics: Bubbles follow parabolic trajectories with consistent gravity. Larger bubbles bounce higher than smaller ones.
game_rules.scoring_system: Large bubble split: 100 pts, Medium bubble split: 200 pts, Smallest bubble pop: 500 pts.
game_rules.win_condition: Destroy all bubbles on the screen.
game_rules.lose_condition: Player collision with any bubble or timer reaching zero.

how_to_build: uv venv && uv pip install pygame
how_to_play: Goal: Eliminate all bubbles to score points and advance. Control the player with Left/Right Arrow keys. Press Spacebar to fire the vertical wire. Avoid contact with bubbles. Use the wire to split large bubbles until they are small enough to be removed entirely.
